raw: * HTML templating module. This is a wrapper for mustache.js which is a
* "framework-agnostic way to render logic-free views".
* For further details, please visit the mustache.js documentation here:
*   https://github.com/janl/mustache.js/blob/master/README.md

@description.name: @description
@description.body: HTML templating module. This is a wrapper for mustache.js which is a "framework-agnostic way to render logic-free views". For further details, please visit the mustache.js documentation here: https://github.com/janl/mustache.js/blob/master/README.md

raw: * Helper method which provides direct access to templates stored as HTML in
* the DOM. The DOM node with the given ID will be treated as a template,
* parsed and a new DOM element will be returned containing the parsed data.
* Keep in mind that templates can only have one root element.
* Additionally, you should not put the template into a regular, hidden
* DOM element because the template may not be valid HTML due to the containing
* mustache tags. We suggest to put it into a script tag with the type
* text/template.
* @attachStatic{qxWeb, template.get}
* @param id {String} The id of the HTML template in the DOM.
* @param view {Object} The object holding the data to render.
* @param partials {Object} Object holding parts of a template.
* @return {qxWeb} Collection containing a single DOM element with the parsed
* template data.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Helper method which provides direct access to templates stored as HTML in the DOM. The DOM node with the given ID will be treated as a template, parsed and a new DOM element will be returned containing the parsed data. Keep in mind that templates can only have one root element. Additionally, you should not put the template into a regular, hidden DOM element because the template may not be valid HTML due to the containing mustache tags. We suggest to put it into a script tag with the type text/template.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {String} The id of the HTML template in the DOM.
@param.description: The id of the HTML template in the DOM.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: view {Object} The object holding the data to render.
@param.description: The object holding the data to render.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: partials {Object} Object holding parts of a template.
@param.description: Object holding parts of a template.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{qxWeb} Collection containing a single DOM element with the parsed
 template data.
@return.description:
Collection containing a single DOM element with the parsed
 template data.

raw: * Original and only template method of mustache.js. For further
* documentation, please visit mustache.js.
* @attachStatic{qxWeb, template.render}
* @param template {String} The String containing the template.
* @param view {Object} The object holding the data to render.
* @param partials {Object} Object holding parts of a template.
* @return {String} The parsed template.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Original and only template method of mustache.js. For further documentation, please visit mustache.js.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: template {String} The String containing the template.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: view {Object} The object holding the data to render.
@param.description: The object holding the data to render.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: partials {Object} Object holding parts of a template.
@param.description: Object holding parts of a template.

raw: * Combines {@link #render} and {@link #get}. Input is equal to {@link #render}
* and output is equal to {@link #get}. The advantage over {@link #get}
* is that you don't need a HTML template but can use a template
* string and still get a collection. Keep in mind that templates
* can only have one root element.
* @attachStatic{qxWeb, template.renderToNode}
* @param template {String} The String containing the template.
* @param view {Object} The object holding the data to render.
* @param partials {Object} Object holding parts of a template.
* @return {qxWeb} Collection containing a single DOM element with the parsed
* template data.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Combines {@link #render} and {@link #get}. Input is equal to {@link #render} and output is equal to {@link #get}. The advantage over {@link #get} is that you don't need a HTML template but can use a template string and still get a collection. Keep in mind that templates can only have one root element.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: template {String} The String containing the template.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: view {Object} The object holding the data to render.
@param.description: The object holding the data to render.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: partials {Object} Object holding parts of a template.
@param.description: Object holding parts of a template.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{qxWeb} Collection containing a single DOM element with the parsed
 template data.
@return.description:
Collection containing a single DOM element with the parsed
 template data.

raw: * If the given node is a DOM text node, wrap it in a span element and return
* the wrapper.
* @param el {Node} a DOM node
* @return {Element} Original element or wrapper

@description.name: @description
@description.body: If the given node is a DOM text node, wrap it in a span element and return the wrapper.
